TopicTitle: Squad Is at Cons this weekend.

Articles.Content:
I hope people with better google-fu than me will find videos and post the links. They were at a Unity event and are at PAX.

Unity Talk finally posted.

Update 9/13/2013 another PAX interview finally posted.

Update 8/31/2013

At 3pm PST or 6pm EST on Sunday 9/1 there might be something KSP related on Twitch

http://www.twitch.tv/twitch

/Update thanks macegee

.22 reveal interview from the above

http://www.twitch.tv/twitch/b/454897273

Go to 5:21 for the interview.

Just the .22 reveal section on Youtube.

Images from the Twitch interview on .22

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Update 9/1/2013

Game informer article. Nothing really about.22 but interesting.

http://www.gameinformer.com/games/kerbal_space_program/b/pc/archive/2013/09/01/the-story-of-kerbal-space-program.aspx

/Update

Found a podcast from Gaming Dead KSP discussion starts at 16:50

http://gamingdead.com/2013/09/02/gaming-dead-podcast-pax-prime-day-3

Game Front Article. Nothing new for us but good background info on the game.

http://www.gamefront.com/the-fascinating-origin-of-kerbal-space-program/

it is a part 1 though so maybe there will be more.

Joystiq article just posted

http://www.joystiq.com/2013/09/04/the-atypical-story-of-kerbal-space-programs-indie-flight-to-suc/

Edited September 24, 2013 by FITorion
Man, that lifter on one of screens looks just like one of Whackjob's ungodly creations You're a bad influence on Devs Whack
yeah its pretty cool that they have a ksp tournament but those kerbal figures look awesome

I'd like to take this chance to thank everyone involved in relaying all this new information from PAX to the rest of the community.

Just thinking about the amount of work that must have gone into KSP related PAX coverage makes my head spin.

Thank you very much, person at Squad who was in charge of making this small miracle become reality, I mean it.

Looks like they're enjoying it.

This will bring lots of new players and popularity to KSP, and they really deserve it.

The competition was loads of fun! My launches were very Kerbal, but in the end I somehow managed to get third. I also got to chat up C7 while my launches were failing, which probably didn't help me any.

yeah its pretty cool that they have a ksp tournament but those kerbal figures look awesome

You can buy them from here:

https://www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/kspstore/index.php?p=shapeways

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
hey Capt'n you ever going to do any more vids?
Ach. My grandparents live in Vancouver. Maybe I can send them over to get me stuff
There was something mentioned about some 0.22 information being revealed at a convention. Has that happened? If not, is there a schedule for it? If so, can we see it?

Man, that lifter on one of screens looks just like one of Whackjob's ungodly creations You're a bad influence on Devs Whack

Hehe. He needs about forty more Rockomax 64s and maybe twenty-five Rockomax 32s. And maybe four or eight rovers bolted to the outside.

Flowz0r

I'd like to take this chance to thank everyone involved in relaying all this new information from PAX to the rest of the community.

Just thinking about the amount of work that must have gone into KSP related PAX coverage makes my head spin.

Thank you very much, person at Squad who was in charge of making this small miracle become reality, I mean it.

If you find any other source of info please post a link. I'm relying on the twitter stuff they put out and Have searched Youtube for variations on PAX PRIME 2013 "KSP" "Squad" and have found nothing.

If anyone finds any gaming news site that does anything about KSP please post a link.

I'll try to put as many links up in the OP as we find so everything's in one place.

I imagine the 0.22 PAX reveals are going to be posted in a dev blog once the event is over. I think the initial showcase is for PAX attendees only. Now that's not to say someone attending the reveal couldn't just post the information on a thread on the forums. *hinthint*

Edited September 1, 2013 by swiftgates24

They just finished their twitch interview. Showed a basic launch to orbit and recovery... they forgot to turn off physics warp before the chute fully opens...

Then they showed video of 2 new research parts. One is an in line with the rocket part that has slats that open up. Another looks like one of the new large radial RCS tanks but the center section opens to reveal some sort of science instrument. Then there was a quick skim over the tech tree showing it revealing new branches of tech research as things are discovered. It looks like the tech tree won't already be visible but your research will reveal only you next options and not things further down the line of research.
They also showed sub-assembly loading and saving.
Yeah. I noticed a "sub-assembly drop zone" on the UI bellow the parts on the left. I guess you can drag your section you wish to save as a sub-assembly into that area to save it for future use.

And the new subassembly manager, which looks pretty sweet. I'm personally not wild about the Science Bay and whatever that radial RCS tank-like thingy was. I'll have to see when 0.22 is out, but just give me my sandbox game.
If you only want sandbox, you'll find these next few updates...disappointing.

I'm looking around but I'm not finding very many videos being posted from PAX. and the twitch stream doesn't look like it saved an archive of itself... maybe there will be something a few days after... I don't know.

Squad has a panel tomorrow at 11AM PST 2pm EST so maybe we'll get more from that.

Apparently I was wrong:

http://www.twitch.tv/twitch/b/454897273

relevant section starts at 5:21

Edited September 1, 2013 by FITorion
